citeinfo.title: Conservation Areas in the Mojave Desert

descript.abstract: The Moj_ConservationAreas layer is a mosaic of data including the Arizona, California, Nevada, and Utah Areas of Critical Environmental Concern (ACEC), Critical Habitat Unit (CHU), the Red Cliffs Desert Reserve (RCDR), the Desert Tortoise Conservation Center (DTCC), the Desert National Wildlife Refuge, State and National Parks, National Monuments, National Conservation Areas, Beaver Dam Wash National Conservation Area, and the Boulder City Conservation Easement (BCCE). Landownership classification for Wilderness Areas and Wilderness Study Areas were also included. Desert Tortoise Natural Area (DTNA) line work revised per file sent from Desert Tortoise Preserve Committee 5-9-12. Line work for Snow Canyon State Park replaced with file sent from Utah State Parks and Recreation 5-9-12. Red Rock Canyon State Park line work was revised per file sent from Calif. Dept. of Parks and Recreation 5-16-12.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this dataset is to portray the location of Tortoise Critical Areas throughout the Moajve Desert and may be used for illustration and mapping, analyzing critical areas, and conducting inventories.
descript.supplinf: Boundaries from the National Park Service (NPS), the Desert National Wildlife Range (DNWR), and the Grand Canyon-Parashant NM have been included for reference.

idinfo.useconst: This dataset is not reliable enough to used as a legal document.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

procstep.procdesc:
AZ ACEC - downloaded the Feb 2009 zipped polygon shapefile from the AZ BLM GIS data site.
NV ACEC - downloaded the Jul 2007 zipped polygon shapefile from the NV BLM GIS data site.
CA ACEC - downloaded the Jan 2000 zipped ESRI export file from the CA BLM GIS data site and converted to a coverage, then to a polygon shapefile.
UT ACEC - data received as polygon shapefiles emailed from Carla Garrison (BLM Utah). The following corrections were made: o The polygon just north of the city of Motoqua appears to be incorrectly named "BEAVER DAM SLOPE ACEC". There are 2 unnamed polygons on the Utah/Arizona/Nevada border that appears to be the correct ones (their DATA field also shows "bdslope_ex"). This was verified by matching the acreage listed at the BLM site for the ACEC with the ACRES field of these polygon, and they matched (48,519 acres). These southern polygons were renamed "BEAVER DAM SLOPE ACEC" and the polygon north of Motoqua was renamed " ". o There is an unnamed polygon adjacent to the one named "LOWER-VIRGIN-RIVER ACEC" that should also be part of this ACEC. This was verified by matching the acreage listed at the BLM site for the ACEC with the ACRES field of these polygon, and they matched (1822 acres). The unnamed polygon was renamed to "LOWER-VIRGIN-RIVER ACEC". o The schema did not include a REASON field but this data was available through the BLM site (http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/prog/blm_special_areas/acecs/utah_acecs.html), so the field was added and the values were calculated according to the website.
UT Red Cliffs Desert Reserve - 2006 data originating from the Washington County GIS Dept.
DWMA - Oct 2003 data originating from shapefiles created by James Essex at the Mojave Desert Ecosystem Program (http://www.mojavedata.gov/index.html).
DTCC - data received as zipped polygon shapefiles emailed from Kim Field and Cat Darst (US FWS).
BCCE - data selected and extracted from the Apr 2003 zipped polygon shapefiles for the Clark County Comprehensive Planning Community District boundaries.
US_FedLands2005 - data available for download through the National Atlas website of Dec 2005 polygon shapefiles for U.S. lands owned or administered by the federal government. The following were selected and extracted through attribute selection: o National Park Service: AGBUR = 'NPS' o Desert National Wildlife Range: NAME1 or NAME2 like '%Desert National Wildlife Range%' o Grand Canyon-Parashant NM: NAME1 or NAME2 like '%Grand Canyon-Parashant N%'
All layers were merged into the SW_TCA base dataset through ArcCatalog by starting with CA ACEC as the base feature class, adding/removing the necessary fields, then loading the other layers into it.
In this dataset, BIOLOGICAL=Y was repurposed to specifically define a TCA as opposed to any biological species. For sources that did not contain the CULTURAL, BIOLOGICAL or SCENIC fields, the BIOLOGICAL field was determined and set based upon the description in REASON. First, all records where BIOLOGICAL=null were selected and calc'd to BIOLOGICAL=N. Then, any features containing the following strings in REASON which are more likely related to Desert Tortoise conservation were selected and calc'd to BIOLOGICAL =Y. o Wildlife o Tortoise o Sensitive Species o T&E o Mix o RNA o Special Status Species Habitat
Changed the following three anomalies to BIOLOGICAL=Y: o "Arden/Desert Tortoise CC" overlaps the Desert Tortoise Conservation Center, but since REASON was attributed as "HISTORIC RAILROAD CONSTRUCTION, AND MINING" it was mistakenly removed by the filter. o "THREE RIVERS ACEC" (misspelled as "Riparian, T&IE, Bald Eagle Habitat") was missed in the selection. o "Middle Knob" (attributed as BIOLOGICAL=U) was changed due to presence of rare plant species stated here: http://www.cnps.org/cnps/conservation/pdf/WEMO_3.pdf and http://www.blm.gov/pgdata/etc/medialib//blm/ca/pdf/pdfs/cdd_pdfs.Par.a760c6e3.File.pdf/TG1.notes.fn.2.11.02.PDF. Though it may not be relevant to the Desert Tortoise, this follows the same coding scheme most likely used for the other California ACECs.
Removed data holes by deleting polygons where NAME equals "Not ACEC","Exclusion", or "".
Removed the features not potentially related to the Desert Tortoise areas by first selecting "BIOLOGICAL not equal Y". This included some features in northern California (outside the study area) where BIOLOGICAL = ' '. Then, after unselecting NPS, Desert National Wildlife Refuge, and Grand Canyon NM areas to keep them in the map for reference, deleted the selected records.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Y/N if feature is specificaly a tortoise conservation area
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

lineage.Process: CalculateField sde_dtro.SDE_ADMIN.SW_TCA REASON "National Park or Forest" VB #
CalculateField SW_TCA_Clip NAME "Desert Tortoise Conservation Center" VB #
CalculateField Moj_Conserv1 Jurisdict "CA State Parks" VB #
CalculateField Moj_Conserv1 Jurisdict "NV State Parks" VB #
CalculateField Moj_Conserv1 Jurisdict "AZ State Parks" VB #
CalculateField Moj_Conserv1 Desig "Department of Energy" VB #

FeatureClassToFeatureClass R:\Projects\DTRO\GIS\WorkingData\ConservAreas\New\Moj_Conservation.shp "Database Connections\DTRO (Admin).sde" Moj_ConservationAreas # "NAME "NAME" true true false 60 Text 0 0 ,First,#,R:\Projects\DTRO\GIS\WorkingData\ConservAreas\New\Moj_Conservation.shp,NAME,-1,-1;State "State" true true false 2 Text 0 0 ,First,#,R:\Projects\DTRO\GIS\WorkingData\ConservAreas\New\Moj_Conservation.shp,State,-1,-1;Tort_Map "Tort_Map" true true false 5 Text 0 0 ,First,#,R:\Projects\DTRO\GIS\WorkingData\ConservAreas\New\Moj_Conservation.shp,Tort_Map,-1,-1;Desig "Desig" true true false 50 Text 0 0 ,First,#,R:\Projects\DTRO\GIS\WorkingData\ConservAreas\New\Moj_Conservation.shp,Desig,-1,-1;Jurisdict "Jurisdict" true true false 50 Text 0 0 ,First,#,R:\Projects\DTRO\GIS\WorkingData\ConservAreas\New\Moj_Conservation.shp,Jurisdict,-1,-1;TCA "TCA" true true false 3 Text 0 0 ,First,#,R:\Projects\DTRO\GIS\WorkingData\ConservAreas\New\Moj_Conservation.shp,TCA,-1,-1" #
CalculateField "Mojave Conservation Areas" NAME "Fremont - Kramer" VB #
CalculateField sde_dtro.SDE_ADMIN.Moj_ConservationAreas Desig "National Recreation Area" VB #

idCitation.resTitle: Conservation Areas in the Mojave Desert

dataIdInfo.idPurp: The purpose of this dataset is to portray the location of Tortoise Critical Areas throughout the Moajve Desert and may be used for illustration and mapping, analyzing critical areas, and conducting inventories.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Moj_ConservationAreas layer is a mosaic of data including the Arizona, California, Nevada, and Utah Areas of Critical Environmental Concern (ACEC), Critical Habitat Unit (CHU), the Red Cliffs Desert Reserve (RCDR), the Desert Tortoise Conservation Center (DTCC), the Desert National Wildlife Refuge, State and National Parks, National Monuments, National Conservation Areas, Beaver Dam Wash National Conservation Area, and the Boulder City Conservation Easement (BCCE). Landownership classification for Wilderness Areas and Wilderness Study Areas were also included. Desert Tortoise Natural Area (DTNA) line work revised per file sent from Desert Tortoise Preserve Committee 5-9-12. Line work for Snow Canyon State Park replaced with file sent from Utah State Parks and Recreation 5-9-12. Red Rock Canyon State Park line work was revised per file sent from Calif. Dept. of Parks and Recreation 5-16-12.

Consts.useLimit: This dataset is not to used as a legal document.

dataLineage.statement:
AZ ACEC - downloaded the Feb 2009 zipped polygon shapefile from the AZ BLM GIS data site.
NV ACEC - downloaded the Jul 2007 zipped polygon shapefile from the NV BLM GIS data site.
CA ACEC - downloaded the Jan 2000 zipped ESRI export file from the CA BLM GIS data site and converted to a coverage, then to a polygon shapefile.
UT ACEC - data received as polygon shapefiles emailed from Carla Garrison (BLM Utah). The following corrections were made: o The polygon just north of the city of Motoqua appears to be incorrectly named "BEAVER DAM SLOPE ACEC". There are 2 unnamed polygons on the Utah/Arizona/Nevada border that appears to be the correct ones (their DATA field also shows "bdslope_ex"). This was verified by matching the acreage listed at the BLM site for the ACEC with the ACRES field of these polygon, and they matched (48,519 acres). These southern polygons were renamed "BEAVER DAM SLOPE ACEC" and the polygon north of Motoqua was renamed " ". o There is an unnamed polygon adjacent to the one named "LOWER-VIRGIN-RIVER ACEC" that should also be part of this ACEC. This was verified by matching the acreage listed at the BLM site for the ACEC with the ACRES field of these polygon, and they matched (1822 acres). The unnamed polygon was renamed to "LOWER-VIRGIN-RIVER ACEC". o The schema did not include a REASON field but this data was available through the BLM site (http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/prog/blm_special_areas/acecs/utah_acecs.html), so the field was added and the values were calculated according to the website.
UT Red Cliffs Desert Reserve - 2006 data originating from the Washington County GIS Dept.
DWMA - Oct 2003 data originating from shapefiles created by James Essex at the Mojave Desert Ecosystem Program (http://www.mojavedata.gov/index.html).
DTCC - data received as zipped polygon shapefiles emailed from Kim Field and Cat Darst (US FWS).
BCCE - data selected and extracted from the Apr 2003 zipped polygon shapefiles for the Clark County Comprehensive Planning Community District boundaries.
US_FedLands2005 - data available for download through the National Atlas website of Dec 2005 polygon shapefiles for U.S. lands owned or administered by the federal government. The following were selected and extracted through attribute selection: o National Park Service: AGBUR = 'NPS' o Desert National Wildlife Range: NAME1 or NAME2 like '%Desert National Wildlife Range%' o Grand Canyon-Parashant NM: NAME1 or NAME2 like '%Grand Canyon-Parashant N%'
All layers were merged into the SW_TCA base dataset through ArcCatalog by starting with CA ACEC as the base feature class, adding/removing the necessary fields, then loading the other layers into it.
In this dataset, BIOLOGICAL=Y was repurposed to specifically define a TCA as opposed to any biological species. For sources that did not contain the CULTURAL, BIOLOGICAL or SCENIC fields, the BIOLOGICAL field was determined and set based upon the description in REASON. First, all records where BIOLOGICAL=null were selected and calc'd to BIOLOGICAL=N. Then, any features containing the following strings in REASON which are more likely related to Desert Tortoise conservation were selected and calc'd to BIOLOGICAL =Y. o Wildlife o Tortoise o Sensitive Species o T&E o Mix o RNA o Special Status Species Habitat
Changed the following three anomalies to BIOLOGICAL=Y: o "Arden/Desert Tortoise CC" overlaps the Desert Tortoise Conservation Center, but since REASON was attributed as "HISTORIC RAILROAD CONSTRUCTION, AND MINING" it was mistakenly removed by the filter. o "THREE RIVERS ACEC" (misspelled as "Riparian, T&IE, Bald Eagle Habitat") was missed in the selection. o "Middle Knob" (attributed as BIOLOGICAL=U) was changed due to presence of rare plant species stated here: http://www.cnps.org/cnps/conservation/pdf/WEMO_3.pdf and http://www.blm.gov/pgdata/etc/medialib//blm/ca/pdf/pdfs/cdd_pdfs.Par.a760c6e3.File.pdf/TG1.notes.fn.2.11.02.PDF. Though it may not be relevant to the Desert Tortoise, this follows the same coding scheme most likely used for the other California ACECs.
Removed data holes by deleting polygons where NAME equals "Not ACEC","Exclusion", or "".
Removed the features not potentially related to the Desert Tortoise areas by first selecting "BIOLOGICAL not equal Y". This included some features in northern California (outside the study area) where BIOLOGICAL = ' '. Then, after unselecting NPS, Desert National Wildlife Refuge, and Grand Canyon NM areas to keep them in the map for reference, deleted the selected records.
National Conservation Areas, Wilderness Areas, Wilderness Study Areas, and Military Lands were added from each state's ownership data.
Data clipped by Lake Mead and Lake Mojave.
